# Major Scale in F# (Mode: Phrygian, Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
The Major scale in F# is a versatile and commonly used scale in music. When played in the Phrygian mode with a Shape of C, it has a unique and exotic sound characterized by a minor tonality with a lowered 2nd interval.

## Notes and Intervals
The F# Major scale in Phrygian mode with a Shape of C includes the following notes and intervals:
- F# (Root)
- G (b2)
- A# (Major 3rd)
- B (Perfect 4th)
- C# (Perfect 5th)
- D (Major 6th)
- E (Major 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This scale is commonly utilized in various genres such as metal, flamenco, and world music. It adds a dark and mysterious flavor to the music due to the lowered 2nd interval, creating tension and interest in compositions.
